morticia.moglo module¶

exception morticia.moglo.MissingDataArrayAxis[source]¶

Bases: exceptions.Exception

exception morticia.moglo.MissingUnits[source]¶

Bases: exceptions.Exception

class morticia.moglo.Scalar(mnemonic, data, units, attrs=None)[source]¶

Bases: object

The Scalar class is for representation of scalar numeric values, together with units of measure, a mnemonic, being one of those listed in the MORTICIA long_name vocabulary.

A feature of the Scalar class is that the data attribute can only be set using a.data = [value, units]

Construct a scalar value using a MORTICIA mnemonic (from the long_name vocabulary), the scalar value and the units of measure.

Parameters:
  • mnemonic – A string such as ‘efl’ for Effective Focal Length, which is defined in the MORTICIA long_name vocabulary
  • data – The scalar numeric value to be stored
  • units – The units string of the data. This string must be known to the Python Pint package.
  • attrs – A user-defined dictionary of any other attributes for the scalar value. The mnemonic will be looked up in moglo.long_name and the long_name will be added as an attribute.
Returns:
__init__(mnemonic, data, units, attrs=None)[source]¶

Construct a scalar value using a MORTICIA mnemonic (from the long_name vocabulary), the scalar value and the units of measure.

Parameters:
  • mnemonic – A string such as ‘efl’ for Effective Focal Length, which is defined in the MORTICIA long_name vocabulary
  • data – The scalar numeric value to be stored
  • units – The units string of the data. This string must be known to the Python Pint package.
  • attrs – A user-defined dictionary of any other attributes for the scalar value. The mnemonic will be looked up in moglo.long_name and the long_name will be added as an attribute.

Module contents¶

morticia.U_(units)[source]¶

Returns a pint.Quantity of magnitude one with the given units

Parameters:units – A string providing a unit of measure in the pint unit registry
Returns:A pint.Quantity object with a magnitude of 1 and the specified units.
